benchmark_details.name: DoCo (Document Coverage)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a new task of predicting the coverage of a text document for relation extraction (RE), along with a dataset of 31,366 diverse documents for 520 entities. The dataset includes annotations for document coverage and is designed to support experimental comparisons for relation extraction.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To introduce a systematic approach for analyzing and predicting document coverage for relation extraction.

data.source: Collection of 31,366 web documents for 520 distinct entities, utilizing search engine queries and web scraping methods.
data.annotation: Automated extractions and coverage labels generated via relation extraction APIs.

methods: Classification using features and pre-trained language models
methodology.calculation: F1 scores calculated based on the model predictions for document coverage.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 score indicates better model performance in predicting document coverage.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 score of up to 46% for the HERB model.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against state-of-the-art baselines and with different ground truth variants.
